newsitem.title: FRANCE: France, Germany to step up parliamentary links.
newsitem.headline: France, Germany to step up parliamentary links.

text.p: France and Germany, who see themselves as the main axis of the European Union, are to create a joint commission of 40 deputies to step up parliamentary cooperation, French deputies said on Thursday.
The commission of the two lower houses, comprising 20 members of the French National Assembly and 20 from the German Bundestag, would meet twice a year to discuss subjects of common interest.
A first meeting was scheduled for Paris in June.
French National Assembly speaker Philippe Seguin and Bundestag president Rita Suessmuth would preside over the commission. Seguin would travel to Bonn in March to work out details of the commission.
